title.narrative: Indigenous rights and culture in Adivasi forest communities

description.narrative: Rights and dignity of Adivasis are in many ways threatened even by India's development aims/measures which discriminate against their life-heritage. More than 30 million Adivasis have been thus displaced by development projects in India during the last 60 years ? Adivasis being around 50 % of the development-displaced people even though they are less than 10 % of India's population. Most exposed to human rights violations in Chattisgarh + neighboring states are the Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups' (P VTGs) like Baiga Birhor Kamar Pahadi Korba Kutia or Panga communities.Big development projects like mines forest plantations + dams endanger PVTG communities' subsistence life-heritage + culture pushing PVTGs to the margins of existence away from their hom es and habitats where they have been able to live by carbon-binding forest-regeneration based livelihoods like minor forest produce gathering by traditional subsistence cultivation bamboo work + other indigenous ways of life adapted to the local environmen t.Our project supports the PVTG-Adivasi communities to defend their traditional forest habitat + community rights their indigenous occupations + means of subsistence compliant to India's Forest Rights Act (FRA) in Chhattisgarh + 3 neighboring states. FRA p rotects equality of rights providing also for PVTGs tenurial security their indigenous rights to habitat self-determined livelihood + environment to be legally registered equally for women. But the implementation of these rights requires from the PVTG comm unities a lot of activities for which they need our support.Project supports PVTG women also to defend their rights to water health education + information. It also activates PVTG Development Authorities to bottom-up planning and transparency to carry ou t their duties with the allocated PVTG budgetary provisions - to address PVTGs' declining population literacy below 5% + remote isolated habitation (etc.). Tasks of PVTG Development Authorities have been neglected by top-down policies non-transparency + go vernmental inertia. PVTGs' cooperation forums workshops + trainings strengthen their unity + make them aware of their rights. Project makes also wider audience aware of threatened sustainable PVTG-life by public events video films photo-exhibition + other documentation/newsletter dissemination and creates national + international campaigning pressure towards the authorities to get PVTGs' rights duly implemented.
